contentrichtext.text: {{redirect|Tenri|the religion|Tenrikyo|the god from Turkic mythology|Tengri}} {{Infobox City Japan |Name= Tenri |JapaneseName= 天理市 |MapImage= Tenri in Nara Prefecture Ja.svg |Region= [[Kansai region|Kansai]] |Prefecture= [[Nara Prefecture|Nara]] |District= |ImageSkyline= Tenri montage.JPG |ImageCaption= Top left:View of Headquarter in Tenri religious community, Top right:Tenri religious school, Middle left:View of a point of side of mount Miwa road, Middle right:Stone site in Ryuo Mount Castle, Bottom:Tenri Reference Museum |Area_km2= 86.37 |PopDate= October 31, 2010 |Population= 69,149 |Density_km2= 800.61 |Coords= |LatitudeDegrees= 34 |LatitudeMinutes= 36 |LatitudeSeconds= |LongtitudeDegrees= 135 |LongtitudeMinutes= 50 |LongtitudeSeconds= |Tree= [[Ginkgo biloba|Ginkgo]] |Flower= [[Ume]] |Bird= |SymbolImage= Flag of Tenri, Nara.png |SymbolDescription= Flag | Mayor=Keisaku Minami |CityHallPostalCode= |CityHallAddress= 605 Kawaharajō-chō, Tenri-shi, Nara-ken |CityHallPhone= 0743-63-1001 |CityHallLink= [http://www.city.tenri.nara.jp/ City of Tenri] }} {{Nihongo|'''Tenri'''|天理市|Tenri-shi}} is a [[Municipality of Japan|city]] located in [[Nara Prefecture|Nara]], [[Japan]]. Tenri is the only city in Japan to be named after a religious group, the [[shinshukyo|new religious movement]] [[Tenrikyo]] which has its headquarters in the city and believes it to be one among other energy centers of the world. Tenrikyo had recommended the name ''Yamabe'', which is [[Yamabe District, Nara|the district]] that the religion's headquarters were located in prior to the 1954 merger. Nevertheless Tenri was chosen instead. The [[Isonokami Shrine]], a [[Jinja (shrine)|Shinto shrine]] of religious, historical and artistic significance, stands in Tenri. As of October 31, 2010, the city has an estimated [[population]] of 69,149 and the [[population density|density]] of 800.61 persons per km². The total area is 86.37 km². The city was founded on April 1, 1954. It is sister city of [[La Serena, Chile|La Serena]], [[Chile]], since 1966. [[Image:IsonokamiGate.jpg|thumb|right|Gate of Isonokami Jingu]] ==Education== * [[Primary Schools]] ** Senzai Elementary School ** Idodo Elementary School ** Yamanobe Elementary School ** Nikaido Elementary School ** Tenri Elementary School ([[Private School]]) ** Yanagimoto Elementary School ** Tanbaichi Elementary School ** Ichinomoto Elementary School ** Fukuzumi Elementary School ** Asawa Elementary School * [[Junior High Schools]] ** Kita Junior High School ** Minami Junior High School ** Fukuzumi Junior High School ** Nishi Junior High School ** Tenri Junior High School ([[Private School]]) * [[High School]]s ** Soekami High School ** Nikaido High School ** Tenri High School ([[Private School]]) ** Tenrikyōkou Gakuen High School * [[Universities]] ** [[Tenri University]] ==Sister cities== * {{flagicon|Brazil}} [[Bauru]], [[Brazil]] * {{flagicon|Chile}} [[La Serena, Chile]] * {{flagicon|South Korea}} [[Seosan]], [[South Korea]] == External links == {{commonscat-inline}} *{{ja icon}} [http://www.city.tenri.nara.jp/ Official website] {{Nara Prefecture}} [[Category:Cities in Nara Prefecture]] [[Category:Tenrikyo]] {{Nara-geo-stub}}
